title: Schema: allow optional issue metadata while keeping strict validation
body:
Synopsis: Add a single optional 'metadata' field to Issue input for course/demos, without allowing arbitrary extra keys.

## Background
Issue input validation is intentionally strict (great for reliability). For teaching, it would be useful to attach optional course/difficulty context to issues without loosening validation broadly.

## Requirements
- Extend the Issue model to allow an optional 'metadata' object/dict.
- Keep strict validation:
  - only allow the 'metadata' field (do not allow arbitrary extra top-level keys)
  - validate metadata type is an object/dict
- Ensure backward compatibility: existing issue JSON files still validate.
- Document the new field in docs.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Existing mock issues validate unchanged.
- [ ] An issue JSON including 'metadata' validates successfully.
- [ ] Unknown extra fields still fail validation.
- [ ] Tests cover positive and negative cases.

## Where to look
- src/agent_mvp/models.py (Issue model)
- tests/test_schema.py (schema validation tests)
- README.md (document input shape)
